div1.p: Head of CoosaFloyd County GeorgiaSeptember 21st 1836 This is to certify that I have resided a number of years, at Major Ridges ferry on the Eastanolle River, and some six or seven years ago_the ferry was very valuable, and considered to be a ferry as valuable as any within the Cherokee Nation_ and also the ferry owned by Mr. John Ross_ bought of the widow Foal at the Junction of Hightower and Eastanolle was also considered as equally valuable as Maj Ridges ferry,
div1.closer: given under my hand Geo W LavenderI think that each of the above Ferries five or six years since made from three to four dollars pr. day G.M. Lavender

div1.p: G. M. Lavender certificate in relation to the value of Major Ridges Ferry
